last_episode_to_air.name: Turnabout Intruder
last_episode_to_air.overview: The Enterprise is in danger when Janice Lester, one of Kirk's former lovers, steals his body.

name: Star Trek
overview: Space. The Final Frontier. The U.S.S. Enterprise embarks on a five year mission to explore the galaxy. The Enterprise is under the command of Captain James T. Kirk with First Officer Mr. Spock, from the planet Vulcan. With a determined crew, the Enterprise encounters Klingons, Romulans, time paradoxes, tribbles and genetic supermen led by Khan Noonian Singh. Their mission is to explore strange new worlds, to seek new life and new civilizations, and to boldly go where no man has gone before.
tagline: To boldly go where no man has gone before

episodes.name: The Man Trap
episodes.overview: Kirk and his crew are at deadly risk from an alien creature that feeds on the salt in a human body and can take on any form.

episodes.name: Charlie X
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psychic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.

episodes.name: Where No Man Has Gone Before
episodes.overview: While exploring the edge of the galaxy, the Enterprise encounters an energy barrier that gives two crewmen godlike powers.

episodes.name: The Naked Time
episodes.overview: A strange alien substance causes the crew to act out their deepest inhibitions, while the ship plummets out of orbit.

episodes.name: The Enemy Within
episodes.overview: A transporter malfunction causes Captain Kirk to split into his "good" and "evil" selves, and a landing party will freeze to death if they don't merge the two back together.

episodes.name: Mudd's Women
episodes.overview: The Enterprise picks up a intergalactic conman, Harry Mudd, and three incredibly beautiful women who harbor a dark secret.

episodes.name: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
episodes.overview: Nurse Christine Chapel is reunited with her old fiance on Exo III, but the scientist has plans for Captain Kirk and the Federation.

episodes.name: Miri
episodes.overview: Kirk and a landing party are stranded on a planet due to a disease that causes any adult to die a painful death, and must deal with the local children who have survived.

guest_stars.character: The Bonk Bonk on the Head Boy
guest_stars.name: John Megna

episodes.name: Dagger of the Mind
episodes.overview: Kirk investigates an experimental facility for holding prisoners and finds a sinister scheme.

episodes.name: The Corbomite Maneuver
episodes.overview: The Enterprise encounters a vast alien ship that sets out to test them.

episodes.name: The Menagerie (1)
episodes.overview: Spock kidnaps his former captain, the crippled Christopher Pike, and heads for a quarantined planet, putting his career and Kirk's life on the line.

episodes.name: The Menagerie (2)
episodes.overview: Spock's court-martial continues as he attempts to justify his abduction of Pike, the theft of the Enterprise, and his heading for a planet declared forbidden by Starfleet.

episodes.name: The Conscience of the King
episodes.overview: Kirk is one of the last survivors who can identify a mass killer, who lurks among a Shakespearean troupe aboard the Enterprise.

episodes.name: Balance of Terror
episodes.overview: Kirk pits the Enterprise against an invisible spaceship testing the Federation's defenses.

episodes.name: Shore Leave
episodes.overview: The Enterprise crew take shore leave on a peaceful, pastoral planet...where their dreams and fantasies come to life.

episodes.name: The Galileo Seven
episodes.overview: Spock  commands a stranded away team when their shuttlecraft is stranded on a planet with hostile natives.

episodes.name: The Squire of Gothos
episodes.overview: The Enterprise finds itself at the mercy of a seemingly omnipotent being who fancies himself an 18th century Englishman.

episodes.name: Arena
episodes.overview: When a mysterious alien race destroy an Earth colony, the Enterprise pursues but Kirk and the alien captain are forced to fight each other by powerful aliens.

episodes.name: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
episodes.overview: The Enterprise collides with a black hole and is thrown back to Earth in the 20th century, where they must find a way back and erase any trace of their presence. Matters become complicated when they rescue an Air Force pilot and cannot return him without changing history...but if he disappears that will change history as well.

episodes.name: Court Martial
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk's career is at stake when he is put on trial for the loss of a crewman during an ion storm.

episodes.name: The Return of the Archons
episodes.overview: The Enterprise encounters a seemingly peaceful civilization run by a ""benevolent"" being named Landru...who intends for them to join his people.

episodes.name: Space Seed
episodes.overview: The Enterprise picks up a crew of genetic supermen from the 20th century...and their leader, Khan, plans to create a new empire.

episodes.name: A Taste of Armageddon
episodes.overview: The Enterprise arrives at a planet to establish diplomatic relations and finds itself in the middle of a "peaceful" war that threatens to destroy the ship.

episodes.name: This Side of Paradise
episodes.overview: The Enterprise crew is trapped in paradise when they come to rescue colonists who have fallen to pacifying alien spores and become infected themselves.

episodes.name: The Devil in the Dark
episodes.overview: Kirk investigates a series of grisly murders on a mining planet that are the work of a seemingly hostile alien creature.

episodes.name: Errand of Mercy
episodes.overview: The Federation and the Klingon Empire teeter on the brink of war as Kirk investigates a humble planet caught in the middle - Organia, inhabited by pacifists

episodes.name: The Alternative Factor
episodes.overview: Kirk and Spock encounter an alien named Lazarus who claims to be from an anti-matter universe.

episodes.name: The City on the Edge of Forever
episodes.overview: Kirk and Spock must travel into the past in order to correct a change that will alter history.

episodes.name: Operation: Annihilate!
episodes.overview: Kirk and the Enterprise must combat parasitic aliens.

episodes.name: Amok Time
episodes.overview: First Officer Spock returns to his home world for a brutal Vulcan mating ritual.

episodes.name: Who Mourns for Adonais?
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise are held captive by an alien who turns out to be the Greek god Apollo.

episodes.name: The Changeling
episodes.overview: The crew of the USS Enterprise deals with an indestructible planet-destroying space probe.

episodes.name: Mirror, Mirror
episodes.overview: A transporter mishap swaps Captain Kirk and his companions with their evil counterparts in a parallel universe. In the so-called Mirror Universe, the Enterprise is a ship of the Terran Empire, an organization as evil as the United Federation of Planets is benevolent.

episodes.name: The Apple
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise visits a mysterious paradisical planet controlled by a computer that is served by the local inhabitants.

episodes.name: The Doomsday Machine
episodes.overview: The starship Enterprise and its heavily-damaged sister ship, the USS Constellation, must work together to stop an alien planet-killing machine headed for the heart of Federation territory.

episodes.name: Catspaw
episodes.overview: Two powerful aliens threaten the well-being of the Enterprise and her crew.

episodes.name: I, Mudd
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk has a second run-in with the conman, Harry Mudd. Mudd is now the supreme ruler of a planet of androids who cater to his every whim.

episodes.name: Metamorphosis
episodes.overview: A shuttle crew from the USS Enterprise encounters a man out of history and his mysterious alien companion.

episodes.name: Journey to Babel
episodes.overview: The Enterprise must transport dignitaries to a peace conference, with an assassin on the loose.

episodes.name: Friday's Child
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise become entangled in a planet's tribal power struggle.

guest_stars.character: Warning call from the S.S. Deidre (voice)
guest_stars.name: Walker Edmiston

episodes.name: The Deadly Years
episodes.overview: Strange radiation exposes the command crew of the Enterprise to the effects of rapid aging.

episodes.name: Obsession
episodes.overview: Captain James T. Kirk becomes obsessed with destroying a deadly entity he once encountered in his youth.

episodes.name: Wolf in the Fold
episodes.overview: A series of bizarre murders points to Mr. Scott as the prime suspect.

episodes.name: The Trouble With Tribbles
episodes.overview: The ship travels to Deep Space Station K7 to guard a consignment of grain bound for Sherman's Planet. On arrival, a trader named Cyrano Jones gives Lt. Uhura a tribble, with dramatic consequences. Kirk and the crew also have to deal with the arrival of Captain Koloth and his Klingon battlecruiser, but the tribbles unexpectedly reveal a plot to poison the grain.

episodes.name: The Gamesters of Triskelion
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk and his companions are abducted into slavery and trained to fight as gladiators for the gambling entertainment of three disembodied beings.

episodes.name: A Piece of the Action
episodes.overview: The Enterprise visits a planet with an Earth-like 1920s gangster culture, with Runyonesque dialog and costumes.

episodes.name: The Immunity Syndrome
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise encounters an energy-draining space creature.

episodes.name: A Private Little War
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise discovers Klingon interference in the development of a formerly peaceful planet and joins them in what becomes an arms race.

episodes.name: Return to Tomorrow
episodes.overview: Telepathic aliens take control of Captain Kirk's and First Officer Spock's bodies.

episodes.name: Patterns of Force
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise tracks down a Federation observer on a planet dominated by a "Naziesque" regime.

episodes.name: By Any Other Name
episodes.overview: Beings from another galaxy commandeer the Enterprise in an attempt to return home.

episodes.name: The Omega Glory
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk must find the cure to a deadly disease and put an end to another Starfleet captain's cultural interference.

episodes.name: The Ultimate Computer
episodes.overview: A skeleton Enterprise crew are assigned to test a revolutionary computer system that is given total control of the ship.

episodes.name: Bread and Circuses
episodes.overview: The Enterprise crew investigates the disappearance of a ship's crew on a planet that is a modern version of the Roman Empire.

episodes.name: Assignment: Earth
episodes.overview: While back in time observing Earth in 1968, the Enterprise crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven who has his own agenda on the planet.

episodes.name: Spock's Brain
episodes.overview: An alien female beams aboard the ship and, after incapacitating the rest of the crew, surgically removes Spock's brain. Kirk and the crew have just hours to locate and replace it before Spock's body dies.

episodes.name: The Enterprise Incident
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise are on a secret mission to steal a Romulan cloaking device.

episodes.name: The Paradise Syndrome
episodes.overview: An alien device on a primitive planet erases Captain Kirk's memory, and he begins a new life with the planet's indigenous people.

episodes.name: And the Children Shall Lead
episodes.overview: On a distant planet, Kirk, Spock and McCoy find a scientific team dead, and their children who, unknown to the crew, have great powers at their disposal.

episodes.name: Is There in Truth No Beauty?
episodes.overview: The Enterprise travels with an alien ambassador whose appearance induces madness.

episodes.name: Spectre of the Gun
episodes.overview: Having been found trespassers into Melkotian space, Captain Kirk and his companions are sent to die in a re-enactment of the gunfight at the O.K. Corral.

episodes.name: Day of the Dove
episodes.overview: An alien force drives the crew of the Enterprise into brutal conflict with the Klingons.

episodes.name: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise rush to stop an asteroid from colliding with a Federation world, but discover the asteroid is actually an inhabited generation ship.

episodes.name: The Tholian Web
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk is caught between dimensions while the crew of the Enterprise works to retrieve him. All the while, the Tholians demand that the Enterprise leave their space.

episodes.name: Plato's Stepchildren
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise encounters an ageless and sadistic race of humanoids with the power of telekinesis and who claim to have organized their society around Ancient Greek ideals.

episodes.name: Wink of an Eye
episodes.overview: Invisible "time-accelerated" aliens take over the Enterprise and attempt to abduct the crew for use as "genetic stock".

episodes.name: The Empath
episodes.overview: While visiting a doomed planet, the landing party is subject to torturous experiments by powerful aliens.

episodes.name: Elaan of Troyius
episodes.overview: The USS Enterprise ferries a spoiled princess whose betrothal to a royal Troyian is hoped will bring peace to a star system at war.

episodes.name: Whom Gods Destroy
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk faces off with a demented shape-shifting starship captain determined to control the universe.

episodes.name: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
episodes.overview: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict

episodes.name: The Mark of Gideon
episodes.overview: A race of overpopulated aliens abduct Captain Kirk to solve their problem.

episodes.name: That Which Survives
episodes.overview: Kirk, McCoy, and Sulu are stranded on a barren planet where a mysterious woman attempts to kill them one at a time, while the Enterprise must travel halfway across the galaxy to rescue them.

episodes.name: The Lights of Zetar
episodes.overview: Strange incorporeal aliens threaten the Memory Alpha station and the Enterprise.

episodes.name: Requiem for Methuselah
episodes.overview: The crew of the Enterprise encounter an immortal human in this science fiction variation on Shakespeare's The Tempest.

episodes.name: The Way to Eden
episodes.overview: The Enterprise picks up a group of space ""hippies"" looking for Eden.

episodes.name: The Cloud Minders
episodes.overview: Captain Kirk races against time to acquire plague-fighting minerals from a world in the midst of a civil uprising against a grievous social class disparity.

episodes.name: The Savage Curtain
episodes.overview: Aliens force Captain Kirk and First Officer Spock to join forces with "Abraham Lincoln" and "Surak" to battle villains in a contest of good vs. evil.

episodes.name: All Our Yesterdays
episodes.overview: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are trapped in two parts of another planet's past—a world threatened with destruction when its sun goes supernova.

episodes.name: Turnabout Intruder
episodes.overview: The Enterprise is in danger when Janice Lester, one of Kirk's former lovers, steals his body.
